Package com.charliai.activities.api

Class Intents

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.charliai.activities.api.Intents
  • public class Intents
extends java.lang.Object
    The Intents class supports all the processing and in-memory storage of intents information during activity processing. Marshalling and un-marshalling of the JSON data is limited in this version for expediency. Additional effort in constructing and deconstructing JSON messages can be added in a future release. Therefore most of the intents are stored in JSON objects and this class provides helper methods.
    Author:
    kevincollins

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Intents()
      Default constructor that creates a new Intents objct that can be built up rather than initialized by pre-existing intents JSON.
      Intents​(org.json.JSONArray intentsInput)
      The Intent instantiation method will create a new intent object based on the JSON Array passed as a parameter.

      Gets the intent, based on the intent name, from the hash map.
      boolean hasEntity​(java.lang.String entity)
      Helper method to see if a particular entity exists across all the intents.
      boolean hasIntent​(java.lang.String intent)
      Helper method to see if a specific intent is available.
      void putIntent​(Intent intent)
      Puts a single intent into the hash map of intents and will also copy all the entities into an in-memory collection for indexing and retrieval.

      Sets the intents hash map based on the incoming JSON Array.
      org.json.JSONArray toJSONArray()
      Returns a JSONArray of the intents.
      org.json.JSONObject toJSONObject()
      Returns a JSON Object representation of the Intents.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a JSON string representation of the Intents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Intents

        public Intents()
        Default constructor that creates a new Intents objct that can be built up rather than initialized by pre-existing intents JSON.

      • Intents

        public Intents​(org.json.JSONArray intentsInput)
        The Intent instantiation method will create a new intent object based on the JSON Array passed as a parameter. The formatted JSON must match in the standard JSON required by the intents message format.
        Parameters:
        intentsInput - ActivityConfig configuration in JSON format

    • Method Detail

      • getIntent

        public Intent getIntent​(java.lang.String intentName)
        Gets the intent, based on the intent name, from the hash map.
        Parameters:
        intentName - The key to the intent

      • putIntent

        public void putIntent​(Intent intent)
        Puts a single intent into the hash map of intents and will also copy all the entities into an in-memory collection for indexing and retrieval.
        Parameters:
        intent - The intent data as a JSON Object

      • setIntents

        public void setIntents​(org.json.JSONArray intents)
        Sets the intents hash map based on the incoming JSON Array.
        Parameters:
        intents - The JSON representation of the intents as a JSON array.

      • toJSONArray

        public org.json.JSONArray toJSONArray()
        Returns a JSONArray of the intents.
        Returns:
        JSONArray containing the list of intents

      • toJSONObject

        public org.json.JSONObject toJSONObject()
        Returns a JSON Object representation of the Intents.
        Returns:
        JSONObject output of all the intents

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a JSON string representation of the Intents.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String output of all the intents

      • hasIntent

        public boolean hasIntent​(java.lang.String intent)
        Helper method to see if a specific intent is available.
        Parameters:
        intent - String intent name
        Returns:
        boolean if intent exists

      • hasEntity

        public boolean hasEntity​(java.lang.String entity)
        Helper method to see if a particular entity exists across all the intents.
        Parameters:
        entity - String entity name
        Returns:
        boolean true if entity exists
